channel.title: Help with Java
channel.description:
Well yea, I'm trying to learn new languages! :P I've been having compiling errors though. Can't seem to fix it. :cry:
Error : http://img97.imageshack.us/img97/5287/jmmmoh9.png
I'm positive it has nothing to do with the code.. xP as I copied it right from java's site. I use JCreator because the command prompt gives me errors too.
Help is greatly appreaciated.
Here is where my jdk is. http://img237.imageshack.us/img237/3317/picxxxgf7.png
What my environmental variables look like. I think the problem lies here but not really sure what to fix..... http://img237.imageshack.us/img237/1595/pathzrb7.png
Thanks!

item.title: Help with Java
item.dc:creator: @Xerxes Xerxes
item.description:
@Xerxes wrote:

Good.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Java
item.dc:creator: @WhiteShadow WhiteShadow
item.description:
@WhiteShadow wrote:

[quote=“Xerxes, post:7, topic:13562”]Keep in mind when trying to run it, either do:

javac XXX.java
or
java XX

Also

The source file is probably placed in one directory, while the class file somehow ends up in another, and the JVM is looking in the directory that stores the source. Make sure that you have the classfile in the correct directory.[/quote]

I don’t get what you meant in the first part… I’m pretty sure I set it up all correctly.

EDIT.

Yay it worked in JCreator. x) Thanks for everyone’s help. <3

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Java
item.dc:creator: @Xerxes Xerxes
item.description:
@Xerxes wrote:

Keep in mind when trying to run it, either do:

javac XXX.java
or
java XX

Also

The source file is probably placed in one directory, while the class file somehow ends up in another, and the JVM is looking in the directory that stores the source. Make sure that you have the classfile in the correct directory.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Java

item.description:

are you totally positive you compiled before you attempted to run it?

item.description:
@WhiteShadow wrote:

[quote=“Galook, post:4, topic:13562”]ya jcreator is a dick…

i ran a program on bluej, it worked…
same program on eclipse, it worked…
and then it didnt work in jcreator…

i dotn know wwhy though, its just never worked with me[/quote]

Lol, ok… But even if JCreator sucks I would like to fix this problem!

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Java
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

It can’t find the class. Try “JavaC …” then “Java”. If it dosen’t help then I’m stumped.

This is my classpath, works fine. “Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.”. I know I need to update java.

Read full topic
